body.description: At nuLOOM, we believe that floor coverings and art should not be mutually exclusive. Founded with a desire to break the rules of what is expected from an area rug, nuLOOM was created to fill the void between brilliant design and affordability.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Beautiful & Natural The perfect combination of style and durability, our jute, sisal, and seagrass rugs bring home effortless sophistication. Hand Made with Love Crafted with love and care, hand made rugs carry the spirit of the artisans that made them. Each piece is marked by subtle but individual differences that make your rug unique. Perfect for Your Living Room or Bedroom Jute, sisal, and seagrass rugs work best in lower-traffic areas of your home such as bedrooms, living rooms, dens, and dining rooms. Caring for Your Rug Handmade rugs should be treated more carefully than machine-made rugs. We recommend shaking off any dirt or debris rather than vacuuming.

nuLOOM Non-Slip Grip Rug Pad nuLOOM Ultra Premium Non-Slip Rug Pad nuLOOM Comfort Grip Rug Pad Features Standard Premium Standard Material PVC 100% Recycled Synthetic Fibers PVC Thickness 0.15 Inch 0.25 Inch 0.2 Inch Cut to Size ✓ ✓ ✓

Find the perfect rug size for your room For smaller areas we recommend a 5’ x 8’ or 6’ x 9’ rug. If you are placing the rug under a coffee table, make sure that it can accommodate all four legs of the table Larger rooms typically require a rug that is between 6’ x 9’ and 8’ x 10’. Place the front legs of your sofa on top of the rug or have all four legs rest on the rug To have furniture framed in the center of a large room, we recommend a 9’ x 12’ or larger rug. An equal amount of floor space (between 12” - 18”) should be left on all sides if possible

About nuLOOM At nuLOOM we believe home decor is a form of self expression. Over the past 20 years we have built our company by filling the void between brilliant design and affordability. We create unique designs and source our items from artisan manufacturers all of the world.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 17, 2022
reviews.reviewText: This rug has a boho look to it which mixes well with modern/mid century look. it's a soft rug, and not sturdy. It is not heavy and will not lay heavy on the floor. This is a lightweight rug that will be easy to trip on, and easy to get sucked up into the vacuum, so be careful with it. But it has a great vibe and is muted and vintage/boho at the same time. And is a great price. So it's a keeper for me!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 19, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Beautiful vintage look
reviews.reviewText: This rug was exactly what I needed for this spot. Seems to be well made and the price wasn't to bad.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 16, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great texture and lays nice and flat
reviews.reviewText: This rug has an awesome chunky jute texture. Softer than I expected, and aside from a few rough pieces in the jute rope it’s very comfortable on bare feet. You will want to pick up a rug mat if putting this on a solid surface since it has a tendency to slide. The weave is pretty tight at the edges with the fringe which slightly distorts the shape but that is the only issue I could mention

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 6, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect mix of trend, quality, and price
reviews.reviewText: First, this rug is absolutely stunning. I've had it for two weeks. Every person who has come over in that two weeks has commented on the rug, asking where they can find it. It's just a perfect combo of timeless and trendy.Second, I vacuum All. The. Time. I have a dog + two kids + hubby's work boots to contend with, so I vacuum at least daily. This rug does GREAT handling the vacuuming. I use a Dyson on the low setting. No issues.Third, the quality is SO fantastic. Not to mention the value for the money. It also came packaged very nicely and when I unrolled it, the rug laid nice and flat - no awkward rolling or weird bumps.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 29, 2021
reviews.reviewText: This rug is very pretty but thin and very slippery on wood . You’ll need to put a non slip pad underneath. It is also very uncomfortable under foot. I would have normally returned it, but since it is in an office with little traffic it will work for us . It is very pretty and I have received compliments from visitors

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 11, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I LOVE this rug. I bought it for my breakfast nook and it is PERFECT.I will say, the colors are much more muted in person than what is shown, however, I had read the reviews prior to purchasing it and it was the fact that the colors were more muted in person that made me want to buy it. If you’re looking for a rug with cottage charm, that wouldn’t be out of place in a Hobbit’s home, this is the rug for you. It is also incredibly soft, which was a surprise to me because it looks like it would have the texture of jute, but it’s more like a worn in cotton feel which is lovely. I haven’t attempted to clean it yet (other than a cursory sweep) so I’m interested to see how it does with a vacuum or my rug shampooer…I’m going to guess, not well since it’s so soft. I think this is a rug that might warrant the purchase of a rug beater and hope that does the trick.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 21, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Pay close attention
reviews.reviewText: Not what I was expecting. I also didn't know what a flatweave jute rug was. It's not a regular rug. You've been warned. For added comfort I bought a 1/2" rug pad to go under it. Without that it would've been extremely uncomfortable. It is absolutely beautiful. It went well with my color scheme like I anticipated. However, it is not as pigmented as the picture.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Not the same in person as photo representation
reviews.reviewText: This is more like a heavy blanket weave than a carpet and is impossible to vacuum. I tried to make it work on top of a jute rug but it’s just won’t stay flat and buckles with movement. The fringe is pretty but never stays flat and is also impossible to vacuum.
Love this rug. It’s perfectly imperfect which is exactly what natural fibre rugs should be like. Plus, it’s softer then normal fibre rugs too.

Thin isn't the right descriptor, nor is loose because the weave is fairly tight - it just doesn't have a rigid backing...definitely recommend an underpad if you're putting it on solid surface flooring so that it doesn't slip (specially when your pet runs through the room :-). It has a very nice aged, subtle and matte colour which is hard to come by in this price bracket.

reviews.reviewTitle: Not durable at all! Will not last!
reviews.reviewText: Had to return this after 3 weeks of very light, respectful, careful use. The patterned part of the weave is basically just dye on what appears to be loose cotten-like fluff, so it 'flakes' off extremely easily, leaving lint-like little balls everywhere. The jute braiding has come undone in a bunch of places in the interior of the rug. There are threads coming loose everywhere. 3 weeks of barely walking on it and it looks terrible. I like the rustic aesthetic but this is just poor craftsmanship.I really wanted to like this rug; I love the rustic look, I love the pattern, I love the colors but there is no way this would last a fraction of what I'd expect for the price. Don't buy, it's not worth it.
